Post-doctoral position/Scientist (m/f/d)
Leibniz-Institut für Analytische Wissenschaften - ISAS - e. V. (ISAS), Dortmund und Berlin
The Leibniz Institute for Analytical Sciences - ISAS - e.V. is a research institute dedicated to the development and improvement of analytical methods and tools for health research and related fields. The ISAS is a member of the Leibniz Association and is publicly funded by the Federal Republic of Germany and its federal states.

In the INA – in vitro detection of drug allergies - project in Dortmund for research and development in the field of bio analytics we invite applications for a

Post-doctoral position/Scientist (m/f/d)

You will be responsible for

Planning of state of the art proteomics experiments to elucidate biomarkers for drug allergies
Detection of protein phosphorylation dynamics to follow signalling events
Development of quantitative peptide assays to validate biomarkers (including peptide design)
Automation of processes for medium throughput analysis
Communication and exchange with an interdisciplinary team to develop innovative in-vitro test for drug allergies
Automation of data analysis and reporting / publication of results
Your profile

Studies in chemistry, biology or related topics
Experience with instrumental analysis, mass-spectrometry, proteomics
Entwicklung von Messabläufen und Prozessen
Safe handling of software for data evaluation and statistical analysis
Structured and analytical way of project planning and conduction
Team player with good communication skills
We offer
Scientific development opportunities in an international cooperative, interdisciplinary research environment and an excellent working atmosphere in a very dynamic and professional team
Extensive state-of-the-art equipment and infrastructure
The opportunity to present your data on international conferences and participate in workshops
Non-residents who apply for this job will receive help from the institute to find accommodation and to handle authorities. Applications from disabled applicants are welcome. ISAS supports the principle of equal opportunity between men and women, and is therefore interested in applications from women. The salary will be according to the German TV-L. The full-time position is offered until 31 of December 2022. The position is available immediately. The position is generally suitable for part-time.

ISAS collects and processes the personal data of its applicants in accordance with European and German legal regulations. Further information on data protection and the processing of personal data can be found at www.isas.de/datenschutz.

Informal inquiries are welcome and can be submitted to the human resources department (personal(at)isas.de).

For further information regarding the institute, please see http://www.isas.de.

Master's degree in a quantitative field with 4 years of industry experience, or Bachelor's degree in a quantitative field with 8 years of industrial experienceProficient in Python, R, or a similar scripting language

Amazon's Intelligent Cloud Control Group in Berlin is looking for a Sr. Data Scientist to develop data science implementations that will revolutionize the way Amazon manages its cloud computing infrastructure. With an ever-growing number of fleets, developers, customers, products, marketplaces, sellers, and businesses the Amazon service graph is one of the largest and most complex technical ecosystems in the world. We are building an Intelligent Cloud Control system that enables Amazon businesses (Retail, Amazon Video, Kindle, and more) to accelerate innovation in the cloud.

As a data scientist in the Intelligent Cloud Control team, you'll partner with technology and business teams to build new services that surprise and delight our customers. We develop cutting edge algorithms that involve learning from large datasets such as monitoring telemetry and logs from every host at Amazon. You will own mining these vast datasets for business insights, developing prototypes to evaluate the viability of new approaches, and designing sustainable data products from these opportunities. You will collaborate with software development engineers to integrate your models into the customer experience.

You will work on mathematical and data problems with a large element of unpredictability. You will analyze and process large amounts of data to find insights that impact every development team at Amazon. You will develop new sophisticated algorithms and improve existing approaches using statistical models, machine learning algorithms, and big data solutions. The products you deliver will revolutionize the way that the Amazon website responds to operational issues, leveraging the most recent advances in machine learning and distributed computing to build automatic remediation systems that cut through the noise and surface emergent issues in real-time.

We’re looking for a scientist capable of using data science and other quantitative techniques to design, evaluate, and implement state-of-the-art solutions for never-before-solved problems.

PhD in quantitative fieldExcellent verbal and written communicationExperienced in using multiple data science methodologies to solve complex business problemsExperienced in handling large data sets using SQL and databases in a business environmentExperienced in building workflows involving large datasets and/or machine learning models in production using distributed computing and big data processing concepts and technologiesStrong troubleshooting and problem solving skillsThrive in a fast-paced, innovative environment

Basic Qualifications
PhD degree or equivalent, in a quantitative field (computer science, mathematics, natural language processing, artificial intelligence, or similar)At least 3 recent publications in a leading journal or conference related to computer science, natural language processing or applied mathematics10+ years experience using machine learning or other NLP techniques, including but not limited to Deep Learning4+ years experience implementing machine learning related techniques using Python or Scala in a distributed system, suitable for large scaleExperience coaching or mentoring team mates (not necessarily in a manager role)Fluency in written and spoken English (German is not required)

As a Principal Scientist on this growing team, you will take on a leading role in the Natural Language Processing (NLP) teams for Amazon Search. We are developing NLP components that cover a wide range of languages, from English and other Indo-European languages to Turkish, Arabic, Japanese and many more, and play a central role in search query processing, product description indexing, string normalization and vector embeddings for queries and products.

You will guide team members on the use of machine learning, tuned on terabytes of product and traffic data, to build or improve NLP technology that we integrate with the production search engine and evaluate using techniques like A/B tests. You will work with the Amazon Search leadership to set direction for the NLP approaches, model architectures and training methods, balancing business-defined performance indicators with the needs of millisecond response times. You will propose and explore publication-worthy innovation.

You will build relationships with stakeholders and partner teams across multiple countries, analyze data for trends, track down the source and meaning of anomalies, select suitable rule-based or machine-learning based techniques and advise team members as they make improvements, closing the loop through data, model, application and customer feedback.

Responsibilities
Define standards for the analysis of customer-focused problems in an industrial settingGuide team members and the leadership team on accurate, efficient and innovative NLP/ML solutionsGet hands-on when building NLP models that can be applied to multiple languagesPublish the developed innovative solutions in leading academic scientific venues in NLP/ML

Preferred Qualifications
Experience working in data or applied science in a consumer product companyExperience using Java or C++ writing production-ready codeFamiliarity with Deep Learning and machine learning frameworks such as SageMaker, PyTorch or TensorFlowExperience in low-level optimization of large-scale neural networksFluency in one or more languages other than English

Fintu Data Science ist ein Startup für Machine Learning basierte Softwarelösungen. Zu unseren Kunden zählen Mittelständler, Start-ups und Non-Profit-Organisationen in Deutschland und dem europäischen Ausland.

In unseren Projekten decken wir die gesamte Data Science Wertschöpfungskette ab, von Data Engineering über die Entwicklung von Algorithmen bis hin zum Deployment als API, Website oder App.

Wir suchen einen Senior Data Scientist für unser Team vor Ort in Berlin.

Deine Rolle
Als Mitglied unseres Teams löst du komplexe Geschäftsprobleme für unsere Kunden. Dazu entwickelst du eigenverantwortlich Analysen, Algorithmen und, zusammen mit unseren Machine Learning Engineers, komplette Machine Learning Pipelines.
Du leitest die Umsetzung von Projekten, von Piloten bis hin zu vollständigen Softwarelösungen, in enger Abstimmung mit uns und unseren Kunden.
Im Laufe eines Projekts entwickelst du nicht nur ein technisches Verständnis für die Daten unseres Kunden sondern durchdringst auch die dahinterliegenden Geschäftsprobleme und -mechanismen.
Du probierst zudem regelmäßig neue Methoden, Technologien und Tools aus, die unsere Projekte besser und effizienter machen und integrierst sie aktiv in unsere Workflows.
Dein Profil
Du hast einen Universitätsabschluss (idealerweise eine Promotion) in einem quantitativen Feld, z.B. Mathematik, Physik, Informatik, Ökonometrie oder eine vergleichbare Qualifikation.
Du bringst ein sehr gutes Verständnis von Statistik und Machine Learning mit.
Du hast mehrere Jahre Programmiererfahrung und beherrschst mindestens eine Programmiersprache (bevorzugt Python) sehr sicher. Dein Code ist strukturiert, lesbar und maintainable.
Du bist vertraut mit moderner Software-Entwicklung (Agile, Git, Continuous Integration, Docker, Cloud Computing).
Du kommunizierst sicher und professionell auf Englisch und Deutsch.
Du bist bereit, ab und an zu unseren Kunden zu reisen.
Was wir bieten
Du arbeitest an spannenden Projekten und Fragestellungen, implementiert in einer modernen IT-Umgebung die du aktiv mitgestalten kannst.
Verschwende deine Zeit nicht mit Politik. Wir sind ein kleines Unternehmen mit schnellen Entscheidungswegen und einer “Hands-on” Mentalität.
Du hast vielfältige Möglichkeiten zur beruflichen Weiterentwicklung innerhalb unserer Firma, sowohl als technischer Experte (Lead Data Scientist, Principal Data Scientist) als auch als Manager (Teamleitung und Abteilungsleitung).
Teile dir deine Arbeitszeit flexibel ein. Wir haben keine festen Vorgaben - jeder ist selbst dafür verantwortlich, dass seine Arbeit erledigt wird.
Unser Büro in Berlin-Kreuzberg bietet dir alles, was du brauchst. Wenn du möchtest, kannst du aber auch bis zu 50% der Zeit remote arbeiten.
Du partizipierst auf Wunsch über unser Beteiligungsprogramm an unserem Firmenerfolg.

Schicke deine Bewerbung oder Fragen gerne an people@fintu.ai.

Position: Data Science Consultant
Location: Berlin, Checkpoint Charlie

I am helping a leading AI in retail consultancy to grow their Data science team by assisting them with hiring 2 additional consultants.

The company are specialists in providing cloud-based AI solutions for some of the largest retail businesses across Europe. They offer out of the box AI solutions that can help companies to better understands their customer segments, providing dynamic pricing and even recommendation engines.

Your Role:
Using Machine Learning and Deep learning to provide AI solutions
Onsite client visits to discuss potential implementations and AI Solutions
Implementation of national and international IT projects


Experience required:
Previous experience as a Data Scientist in a consultancy role
Programming experience in Python, R or Java
Fluency in both English and German

Senior Data Scientist

We’re looking for a data expert who can forecast future trends and lead major projects for a world-renowned food delivery brand. Are you the analytics ace we need? Then keep reading…
Our story (the bitesize version):
Whether they know us as Takeaway.com, Lieferando.de, Pyszne.pl or any of our 11 international brands, we’re connecting food-lovers with the dishes they love. From romantic ramen for two to fries with friends, we’re serving up memorable mealtimes – anytime, anywhere.

We’ve come a long way since our start-up roots back in the days of dial-up internet (remember that?). But our commitment to staying ahead of the game with data analysis has remained constant. And that’s why we need you…
All about your role:
Mealtimes may be about living in the moment, but as our Senior Data Scientist, you’ll be ensuring that the future is even more delicious for our customers.
By implementing effective forecast models, you can offer key insights on industry trends and demand patterns, making projections for the future of logistics – focusing on our ‘Scoober’ driver fleet. You’ll also monitor the performance of your models, finding ways to optimise our operations.
Enjoy project management? That’s a major asset. We’re counting on you to take ownership of projects from beginning to end. That means producing analysis, convening a cross-functional team to undertake it, and keeping track of all improvements you produce.
As a key point of contact within our Analytics set-up, you’ll also be:
Supporting management with risk assessments and mitigation activities
Compiling reports and presenting analysis through a range of tools, models and databases (e.g. Redshift, SQL, Excel, python)
Aligning with our central BI team to help define goals
Can you deliver...
Able to serve up key insights that can help us stay ahead of the game? That’s great. We’re hoping you can also bring us:
4+ years’ experience working with data analysis or data science
MSc (or higher) in Economics, Mathematics, Statistics or another relevant field
Understanding of Amazon Web Services (AWP) and Google Cloud Platform (GCP)
In-depth knowledge of machine learning
Mastery of SQL and experience with BI reporting tools (e.g. Tableau, Qlikview, Looker)
Prior experience of modeling and forecasting
Fluent English language skills (spoken & written). German is a plus
Here is our offer:
That’s everything we need from you as our fantastic forecaster. Here’s what you’ll get as part of the Takeaway.com team:
Competitive salary
Opportunities to innovate and progress in a varied and vital role
Great company-wide events like our summer party and snow event
A dynamic, friendly workplace at the heart of Berlin (we’re right by Potsdamer Platz!)
The chance to work in a team with a flat hierarchy and agile scrum environment
Contribution towards travel costs and ordering lunches
Fresh fruit and delicious tea & coffee in the office
Ready to take on the future with Takeaway.com? Click the button below to send us your motivational letter and CV.

Strong communication skills and experience with building new teams.
Being able to be the bridge between the technical team and the management.
Hands-on experience building and implementing time-series predictive models using modern machine learning algorithms.
Benefits:

Flexible working hours within a global company in different countries.
Unique international department culture with organized events such as free lunch and a great work space in the heart of Cologne.
Chance to head the Global Data Science team of a leading German company.
Paid education/trainings and travel to relevant conferences, nationally and internationally to stay up to date with the market.
If you are interested in discussing this role in a little more detail - please get in touch with us at Even if you are not actively looking at this time but interested in other opportunities we may have, please reach out.

Job_title: ML Engineer, Global Data & Insights - Assisted Relocation to Copenhagen, DK
Job_description:
Do you want to be a part of a fast-moving, dynamic, and international team? And are you passionate about delivering great, data-driven experiences in all touchpoints of the consumer journey? If so, we might have an exciting opportunity for you!
Job description and areas of responsibility:
As ML Engineer, you will deploy and continouosly integrate models to provide insights and ensure end-user have a great experience on our website. You will ensure that models are up to date and correctly implemented in the pipeline. Further to that, you will model data and build tools to be used by data scientist creating ML models for various applications within the organisation – driving development and innovation in the area of AI systems.

As ML Engineer, your key accountabilities will be to:

Model pipelines
Build Python packages or helper other modules, that will be used by data scientist
Deploy ML models (or its output) by developing integrations to other systems or deploy endpoints
Apply data modelling and normalisation techniques on inbound data that is going to be used in the development of ML models
Manage data pipelining surrounding the development of ML models
Your new team:
Say hello to the Global Data & Insights team at Pandora. We are a group of 8 data-driven professionals who support the global marketing teams at Pandora with actionable insights. We have a data lake, a unified analytics platform and solid communication skills that help us translate data into business value. Your new team consists of data scientists, data engineers and an audience manager. Our mission is clear: We are here to deliver data-driven experiences in all consumer journey touchpoints, develop actionable insights to inform business decisions and have fun while doing it.


What is needed to succeed:
We imagine that you have minimum 1 year of professional experience from working with Software Engineering/developing, Computer Science or ML Engineering.

Furthermore, we envision that you have demonstrable experience with:

Git, Python, Spark, PySpark, SQL or similar
Feature engineering
Data modelling and normalization
ML model lifecycle
SDLC methodology
Something about you:
How would you rate yourself on the 4 C’s? We believe that communication, collaboration, critical thinking and creativity are key competences that will help anyone regardless of job function, title or skillset, in becoming a success. If you can see yourself working in a fast-paced entrepreneurial environment with many stakeholders, where your communication and interpersonal skills are needed and your ability to collaborate and innovate as a team is essential, we would love to hear from you.


Additional information:
Application deadline: April 14, 2020

Expected start date: As soon as possible

This role is based in the Pandora Global Office in Copenhagen, Denmark.
Did we get your attention?
We hope you got all your questions answered and feel confident applying for this position, however if you have more questions regarding the position, please contact:

Neil Andrews
Recruiter, Global Office HR
+44 797 378 7498
extneand@pandora.net

If you see yourself in the position and would like to become a part of Pandora’s future PLEASE CLICK HERE TO APPLY. We look forward to hearing from you!

We process applications on a continuous basis, which is why we encourage you to send your application as soon as possible. You can also read more about Pandora on our corporate site www.pandoragroup.com.
Icing on the cake
You will be working out of our beautiful Head Office in Copenhagen V, established in 2016 and designed to unite and inspire our teams. Besides our beautiful interior design we are also proud of our LEED Gold Certification for Energy and Environmental Design. This means that we use as few natural resources as possible and that we use them with respect. The result is a professional and dynamic space that is unique, comfortable and inspirational – and delivers a true Pandora experience to anyone who works here or comes to visit.

Job_title: Junior Data Scientist Advanced Analytics (m/w/d) - Neckarsulm
Job_description:
Mehr als 10.800 Filialen und 150 Logistikzentren in 30 Ländern – das ist Lidl. Um unsere anspruchsvollen Ziele weiterhin effizient erreichen zu können, suchen wir Dich als Verstärkung für unseren Analytics-Bereich. Hier begleiten wir Lidl auf dem Weg zu einem datengetriebenen Unternehmen und pilotieren im „Fail-Fast Ansatz“ innovative Business-Anwendungen im Schulterschluss mit den Fachabteilungen (Vertrieb, Einkauf etc.). Dazu beraten wir diese bei Fragestellungen und gestalten weltweite Geschäftsprozesse mit. Zusätzlich unterstützen wir die Länder, dezentral Analytics-Kompetenzen aufzubauen und durch eine enge Zusammenarbeit die internationalen Synergien zu schöpfen. Bewirke Großes und erlebe, dass sich Dein Einstieg lohnt – am internationalen Hauptsitz von Lidl in Neckarsulm.

Deine Aufgaben

Du identifizierst gemeinsam mit Fachexperten Fragestellungen, bei denen Advanced Analytics einen echten finanziellen Mehrwert für Lidl liefern
Du bereinigst und verknüpfst relevante Datenquellen als Grundlage für weitere Analysen
Du nutzt modernste Algorithmen, um unterschiedliche Geschäftsprozesse zu optimieren und führst den Proof-of-Concept herbei
Du führst gemeinsam mit Fachbereichen Piloten durch, um die Funktionsfähigkeit und den Mehrwert Deiner Modelle in der Praxis unter Beweis zu stellen
Du bereitest gemeinsam mit Kollegen aus der IT den Übergang zur Industrialisierung vor
Du bearbeitest Projekte in interdisziplinären, agilen Teams und präsentierst in regelmäßigen Abständen neue Ergebnisse vor Stakeholdern und dem Management

Dein Profil

Abgeschlossenes Hochschulstudium im Bereich Mathematik/Statistik, Informatik, Physik, VWL, BWL oder einer themenverwandten Fachrichtung
Sehr gute Kenntnisse in der Anwendung von Machine-Learning-, Optimierungs- und Data Mining-Methoden (z.B. mit Python oder R)
Kenntnisse im Umgang mit Datenbanken (SQL, Hadoop, Hive)
Fähigkeit, komplexe Fragestellungen und Szenarien zu verstehen, detailliert zu analysieren und die gewonnenen Erkenntnisse einem nicht technischen Publikum verständlich zu präsentieren
Sehr gute Deutsch- und Englischkenntnisse

Wir bieten

Wir legen Wert darauf, dass sich dein Einstieg bei uns lohnt! Daher profitierst du bei uns nicht nur von einer überdurchschnittlichen Vergütung und allen Sozialleistungen eines Großunternehmens. Wir erkennen die vielfältigen Bedürfnisse unserer Kolleginnen und Kollegen an und entwickeln Lösungen zur Vereinbarkeit von Berufs- und Privatleben. Ein persönlicher Pate macht dich vom ersten Tag an mit deinem Job vertraut und ist dein Ansprechpartner für alle Fragen, rund um das Unternehmen. So findest du dich bei uns schnell zurecht – und so kannst du von Beginn an das kollegiale Miteinander und die individuellen Weiterbildungsmöglichkeiten für dich entdecken.

Aus Gründen der leichteren Lesbarkeit verwenden wir im Textverlauf die männliche Form der Anrede. Selbstverständlich sind bei Lidl Menschen jeder Geschlechtsidentität willkommen.

Aus Gründen der leichteren Lesbarkeit verwenden wir im Textverlauf die männliche Form der Anrede. Selbstverständlich sind bei Lidl Menschen jeder Geschlechtsidentität willkommen.

EUMETSAT is Europe’s meteorological satellite agency, operating satellites that monitor the weather and climate from space - 24 hours a day, 365 days a year.It’s an exciting time to be working at EUMETSAT. As an organisation we’re operating a fleet of 10 satellites delivering weather and climate-related satellite data and images to our users worldwide; helping protect lives, property and industries. However, you don’t need to be an engineer or a scientist to make a positive contribution. Our specialist administrative and support functions play an equally important role in the success of the EUMESAT programmes and are valued members of the EUMETSAT family.BackgroundThe Contracts Division provides contractual and commercial expertise across the organisation, contributing to ensuring that procurements are timely, well managed and follow the EUMETSAT financial and procurement rules, procedures and best practices.As part of an interdisciplinary team, the Contracts Officer will be responsible for the procurement process, preparation, negotiation and post contract award management of contracts, for the development of satellite and ground segment hardware and software systems and the provision of technical services.Duties· Lead, from a contract perspective, procurements of ground segment hardware and software systems, and related development support services, including:- Preparation and evaluation of tender documentation, in coordination with a multidisciplinary team of specialists.- Negotiation of contracts in coordination as part of a multidisciplinary negotiation team.- Management of signed contracts with the designated technical officer, including escalation of critical issues to management, as necessary.· Advise technical divisions on procurement matters and the procurement procedures.· Preparation, negotiation and management of contractual aspects of cooperation agreements with ESA and other development partners.· Participate in and provide EUMETSAT’s contractual inputs to ESA-led procurements of satellites and on-board instruments, and related support services.· Ensuring compliance with EUMETSAT contractual and financial procedures.What we offer· Excellent salary, of up to Euro 8,000/month NET (after income tax) based on skills and experience· Flexible working time including additional flexi-leave· Full medical coverage for employee and family· Attractive pension· 30 days annual leave + 14.5 days public holidays· Training and development support· Relocation allowance (if applicable)EUMETSAT is committed to providing an equal opportunity work environment. Please note that only nationals of EUMETSAT Member States may apply. The EUMETSAT Convention requires that Staff shall be recruited based on their qualifications, account being taken of the international character of EUMETSAT.Qualifications· University degree or equivalent in law, economics or business studies.Skills and experience· 5+ years’ experience preferably in the preparation, negotiation and post contract award management of development and service contracts in the areas of satellite, ground segment facilities, aerospace or high technology products.· Ability to understand complex technical issues and convert these into clear documents on procurement matters and contractual text.· Proven negotiation skills in the context of contractual content and financial matters.· Experience in the use of Enterprise Resource Planning and Document Management tools is desirable.· Ability to work independently and as part of team.· Well-balanced interpersonal and communication skills, combined with a strong customer focus, while also ensuring compliance with the procurement procedures.Benefits:Discounted/free foodCasual dressPrivate medical/dental insuranceWellness programsLife insuranceCompany events & social hoursEducation reimbursementReference ID: VN20 13Job Types: Full-time, PermanentSalary: 145,942.00€ /yearExperience:relevant: 5 years (Preferred)

Automotive Artificial Intelligence (AAI) GmbH is a cutting-edge technology company based in Berlin.

We offer AI based simulation software and services for the virtual testing of automated driving algorithms and autonomous vehicles.

As Senior Research Scientist you will research traffic-related topics, collaborate and exchange research ideas within the Research team, which includes computer scientists specializing in deep learning, computer vision, and self-driving. The aim is to contineously improve our simulated traffic to match its performance to real world driving behavior.

You will provide technical leadership in the field of AI traffic and scenario cloning.
Responsibilities
Research international traffic data bases, literature and vehicle studies to define qualitative and quantitative criteria for AAI's simulated traffic
Research and development in the field of pixel wise segmentation, SLAM, object detection, depth map prediction
Research in vehicle-dynamics related topics to e.g. understand sensor system interactions to identify possible improvements and trade-offs
Work with product owners and engineering teams to develop path-to-market approaches that transition research to products
Develop hypothesis and set up criteria, process to test the hypothesis
Feature extraction on video, LiDAR or Radar data using state-of-the-art methods
Statistical analysis through modelling, simulation and testing
Share results internally and externally through means of publications, presentations and documentation
Technical leadership of the engineering team associated to AI topics
required Skills and Qualifications
Ph.d or excellent Master Degree in Computer Science focussing on Artificial Intelligence/Machine learning/Deep learning, Mathematics, Statistics
Technical development experience with at least 3 years’ industrial experience
Excellent programming skills in Python/C++ and machine learning tools like Tensorflow/PyTORCH/Caffe etc
We love to see
Experience with R, MATLAB, or other modelling tools is a plus
Demonstrated ability of independently executing a research project
Experience in traffic analysis or traffic modelling would be a plus
What we offer
The opportunity to work on the technologies of the future
Lovely co-workers from all over the world
Open and friendly work environment
Flexible work hours
Access to e-learning opportunities via Udemy
Team events such as our monthly breakfast and occasional terrace BBQs
You will be a part of an international team of experienced and highly motivated computer scientists.

Engage in a positive and creative work environment that offers excellent benefits and flexible schedules.

Your Responsibilities:
Analyse huge amounts of data within a data-driven company to support important business decisions
Monitor 2.0+ billion of clients all over the world using our product, infer usage patterns out of event streams and propose possible product innovation
Define client clusters, form profile segments from internal and external data, and utilize modern techniques of Data Mining and Machine Learning to help understand customer behavior
Execute analytics projects and apply appropriate statistical and machine learning techniques to produce key insights and actionable takeaways
Visualize and present findings and recommendations to key stakeholders
Work closely with the marketing team to design, test, and analyze A/B tests
Apply statistics-based customer segmentation and cohort studies for various marketing efforts and channels
Create business metrics and KPIs to understand trends, identify issues, and measure performance of key marketing activities
Work along other Data Scientists in the company and learn advanced methods first hand
Requirements:
University degree in mathematics/statistics, computer science, or an equivalent quantitative-focused field
2+ years of professional experience in Data analytics. Big Data experience is a plus
Familiar with procedures like Logistic regression, Decision trees, k-means, Neural networks, Text mining
Realized projects in Data handling & Analysis projects, hands-on track record in Python data mining, as well as traditional SQL use cases.
Proven knowledge of programming in Python (will be tested within interview process)
Experience in Data visualization (e.g. Tableau) is a plus.
Highly motivated to solve complex problems in close collaboration with others, goal-oriented, and eager to achieve real business effects
Team supporting, volunteering to step in, where they feel might be a help to achieve a goal
Feedback-prone, actively shares own opinion & accommodates feedback from others
We offer:
It’s all about the team: become part of a community that values respect, support and open feedback
Salary structure that reflects market standards, linked to your skills and experience
Plus, additional bonuses that reward your excellent work performance and contribution based on the success of the company
Of course, we offer perks like free fruit and drinks
Good work-life balance with flexible working hours
We truly live and celebrate our cultural diversity: our colleagues come from more than 60 countries and speak more than 40 languages

Tech4Germany ist ein 3-monatiges Fellowship Programm für Digital-Talente unter der Schirmherrschaft des Chefs des Bundeskanzleramtes Prof. Dr. Helge Braun. Seit 2018 arbeiten jedes Jahr die besten Nachwuchstalente aus den Bereichen Tech, Product und Design gemeinsam mit Beschäftigen der Verwaltung an konkreten Herausforderungen der Bundesministerien. In interdisziplinären Teams werden mit agilen und nutzerzentrierten Methoden prototypische Softwareprodukte entwickelt.

Das erwartet Dich:
In einem Team mit 3-4 weiteren Fellows und zwei Ministerial-/Behördenmitarbeiter_innen arbeitest Du eigenverantwortlich an einem hoch-prioritären Projekt der Regierung
Ein Projekt, in dem du neue Technologien, Nutzerzentrierung und agile Arbeitsmethoden einbringen kannst und digitale Antworten auf gesellschaftliche Herausforderungen entwickelst
Ein (Spät-)Sommer in der Startup Hauptstadt Deutschlands
Eine viertägige Exkursion ins Ausland um zu lernen, wie andere Regierungen die digitale Transformation meistern
Regelmäßige Coachings von Leadern aus der Regierung und dem Tech-Bereich durch Fireside Chats und individuelles Mentoring
Eine Community der besten Digital-Talente, die sich für das Gemeinwohl einsetzt
Ein Gehalt von ca. 1.400 Euro netto im Monat


Du bist hier genau richtig, wenn:

Du gemeinsam mit der öffentlichen Verwaltung an der digitalen Zukunft Deutschlands arbeiten möchtest
Du gerne in interdisziplinären Teams über kulturelle Grenzen hinweg auf Augenhöhe arbeitest
Du Dich nicht leicht von Deinem Plan abbringen lässt und andere kommunikativ und motivierend mitnehmen kannst.
Du auch in herausfordernden Situationen den Überblick und Ruhe bewahren kannst.
Du Skills im Engineering, Product oder Design hast und über mindestens B2-Level Deutschkenntnisse verfügst.


Bewirb dich als Engineering, Product oder Design Fellow!


Engineering Fellow (Fullstack -, Backend -, Frontend Engineer oder Data Scientist)

Als Engineering Fellow übersetzt du Nutzeranforderungen an das Produkt in konkrete technische Features. Du hilfst die Daten der Ministerien und Behörden maschinenlesbar zur Verfügung zu stellen und suchst nach Mustern in Daten um die Ressourcen der Behörden effizienter einsetzen zu können. Zudem berätst Du die Design und Product Fellows in deinem Team hinsichtlich der technischen Umsetzbarkeit von Ideen und entwickelst diese prototypisch.

Du hast einen Hintergrund in Informatik oder hast dir gleichwertige Fähigkeiten anderweitig angeeignet
Du hast bereits relevante Arbeitserfahrung gesammelt oder eigene Projekte umgesetzt
Du hast fundierte Coding-Skills in mehreren Sprachen/Frameworks
Du bist in der Lage schnell, fremden Code zu verstehen und diesen als Basis für deine Arbeit zu nutzen
Agile Entwicklungsmethoden und Design Thinking Ansätze sind Dir vertraut


Product Fellow (Product Owner, Product Manager_in oder Product Lead)

Als Product Fellow bist du der zentrale Ansprechpartner für alle Projektpartner und Stakeholder und treibst die Vision des Produkts mit deinem Team voran. Du erfasst gemeinsam mit dem Design Fellow die Nutzeranforderungen und entwickelst aus diesen User Stories, die gemeinsam mit dem Engingeering Fellow umgesetzt werden.

Du hast einen Hintergrund in der digitalen Produktentwicklung und hast bereits erste Arbeitserfahrung gesammelt
Du kannst die Vision des Produktes gut an verschiedene Stakeholder mit einem unterschiedlich hohen technischen Verständnis kommunizieren und diese dafür begeistern
Du hast eine ausgeprägte Fähigkeit zur Vernetzung und Abstimmung mit verschiedenen Stakeholdern und kannst alle Fäden im Team zusammenhalten
Du kennst dich mit verschiedenen User-Research Methoden aus und findest immer die perfekte Vorgehensweise
Agile und Design Thinking Methoden kennst du sehr gut und du kannst Team-Mitglieder in der Umsetzung anleiten


Design Fellow (UX- oder UI Designer_in)

Als Design Fellow erfasst du in Kooperation mit dem Product Fellow Nutzeranforderungen. Du illustrierst Design-Ideen in UI Mockups und Prototypen. Die Designs entwickelst du iterativ auf der Basis von Nutzerfeedback weiter.

Du hast einen Hintergrund in Design (z.B. Kommunikationsdesign, Interface-Design, oder Service-Design) und hast bereits erste Arbeitserfahrung gesammelt
Du hast Erfahrung darin Webseiten, Apps oder andere digitale Produkte zu gestalten
Du besitzt gute Kenntnisse zu verschiedenen Design Tools und Techniken (z.B. Sketch, Figma, Adobe und Personas, Journey Map)
Du besitzt etwas Erfahrung mit verschiedenen Technologien für die Front-End Entwicklung (z.B. HTML, CSS)
Du betrachtest Prototyping als Teamaktivität
Du kennst eine Vielzahl von Prototyping-Methoden und wählst die am besten geeignete aus
Agile Methoden und Design Thinking Ansätze sind Dir vertraut

Interdisziplinarität und Vielfalt wird bei uns groß geschrieben. Daher heissen wir eine hohe Diversität in unserem Fellowship Programm willkommen und freuen uns über Bewerbungen aus allen Altersgruppen, unabhängig von Geschlecht, kultureller und sozialer Herkunft, Behinderung, Religion, Nationalität und sexueller Orientierung.

Mehr Informationen über das Fellowship Programm und unsere Vision findest Du unter www.tech4germany.org

At SoundHound Inc., we believe every brand should have a voice. As the leading innovator of conversational technologies, we're trusted by top brands around the globe. Houndify, our independent Voice AI platform, with 70,000+ users, allows brands to create custom voice assistants that deliver results with unprecedented speed and accuracy.

Our mission is to enable humans to interact with the things around them in the same way we interact with each other: by speaking naturally. We're making that a reality through our SoundHound music discovery app and Hound voice assistant and through our strategic partnerships with brands like Mercedes-Benz, Hyundai, Deutsche Telekom, and Pandora. Today, our customized voice AI solutions allow people to talk to phones, cars, smart speakers, mobile apps, coffee machines, and every other part of the emerging 'voice-first' world.

Our diverse team of engineers, UX/UI designers, writers, data scientists and linguists are all passionate about creating a world with more conversations. With more than 14 years of expertise in voice technology, we have hundreds of millions of end users, and a worldwide team in six countries building solutions for a voice-first world.

About the Role:
---------------


This is a fantastic opportunity to join the core group working on Speech Recognition at SoundHound
Research state-of-the-art methods in Automatic Speech Recognition
Collaborate with Machine Learning engineers to prototype and productionize promising methods

Requirements:
-------------


Experience with Automatic Speech Recognition systems
Knowledge of ASR technologies such as: acoustic modeling, language modeling, HMM, WFST, neural networks, feature extraction
Solid software engineering experience
Hands-on experience in any full stack ASR tool kit, e.g. Sphinx, Kaldi, HTK, Julius
PhD in Speech Recognition or equivalent
2+ years of ASR industry experience
Professional working level fluency in written and spoken English and German

Nice to Haves:
--------------


Research work/publications in applying Deep Learning methods to Speech Recognition
Deep fluency with academic fields relevant to Speech Recognition
Experience in computer vision and pattern recognition
Knowledge of DSP principles, noise reduction, echo cancelation

Our client, the MENA region’s leading driver booking service requires a Data Scientist to join their rapidly developing analytics team based in Berlin.

The Data Scientist will:

Will work closely with the product and engineering teams to define and confront a range of problems and embark on exploratory data analysis projects to achieve better understanding of phenomena as well as to discover untapped areas of growth and optimization.
Help define and track the appropriate key metrics for specific projects.
Design and run randomized controlled experiments, analyse the resulting data and communicate results with other teams.
Collaborate with engineers to build prototype predictive models into production and re-iterate as needed.
Focus on dynamic pricing optimization, optimal dispatching, fraud detection and prevention, ETA prediction and location search optimization.
The Data Scientist will:
Be innovative, detail-oriented, result-focused, have a solid quantitative background - Advanced degree in a quantitative discipline such as Physics, Statistics, Mathematics, Engineering or Computer Science.
Have 2+ years’ experience in data mining, predictive modelling, time series analysis, machine learning, Big Data methodologies, transformation and cleaning of both structured and unstructured data.
Be fluent in English along with excellent oral and written communication skills.
Be proficient and have demonstrated experience in at least 2 of the following: SQL, R, Python, Spark, Hive, RapidMiner.
Have demonstrated experience with database technologies (e.g. Hadoop, Amazon EMR, Hive, Oracle, SAP, DB2, Teradata, MS SQL Server, MySQL) is a plus.
Have demonstrated experience with business intelligence and visualization tools (Tableau, MicroStrategy, ChartIO, Qlik) along with geospatial data processing skills is also a plus.
Be business savvy, and take full ownership of their work from the inception of the idea to the implementation of the final product.
Have knowledge of Agile methodologies
 To apply please send your CV or call 01706 825 199.

Berlin, BE, DE Home Office, DE Wildpoldsried, BY, DE

Job_title: Research Assistant - salary grade E 13 TV-L Berliner Hochschulen
Job_description:
Technische Universität Berlin - Faculty IV - Institute of Telecommunication Systems / Chair for Open Distributed Systems
Research Assistant - salary grade E 13 TV-L Berliner Hochschulen
under the reserve that funds are granted - part-time employment may be possible
Working field:
Statistical inference and logic reasoning are becoming readily available for data processing pipelines in connected vehicles, traffic surveillance and the Web of Things. While statistical inference uses learning techniques for generating or grouping data points to classes or models under symbolic values, logic reasoning addresses the manipulation of symbolic values interlinked via logical axioms, e.g., knowledge graphs. The Department of Open Distributed Systems (ODS) is dedicated in combining these scientific to build distributed processing workflows, for example, combining computer vision tasks such as object detection, semantic segmentation image/visual/video scene understanding with knowledge graphs and logic reasoners.
Currently, we are looking for a scientist to work and research on exciting scientific questions around “Distributed Stream Reasoning”. The successful candidate will conduct research in an interesting and inspiring group.

The opportunity for PhD is given.
Requirements:
Successfully completed university degree (Master, Diplom or equivalent) in computer science, applied mathematics, statistics, or similar subjects with excellent results
Very good language and writing skills in English
Good German language skills is an advantage
Knowledge and Publications in one or some of following areas:
1. Distributed Database Systems/ Graph Database
2. Logic Reasoning (Datalog, Answer Set Programming)
3. (RDF/Semantic) Data Stream Processing
4. Semantic Web
5. Internet of Things, Robotics
6. Computer Vision and Machine Learning
Very good programming skills in Java or C++
Interested in challenging scientific issues and motivation for independent and focused research.
How to apply:
Please send your application with the reference number and the usual documents (in particular cover letter, an academic CV and the names of two references) with the subject “job application” preferably by email to sekretariat@ods.tu-berlin.de or in writing to Technische Universität Berlin - Der Präsident - Fakultät IV, Institut für Telekommunikationssysteme, FG Open Distributed Systems, Prof. Dr. Hauswirth, Sekr. HFT 3, Einsteinufer 25, 10587 Berlin.

To ensure equal opportunities between women and men, applications by women with the required qualifications are explicitly desired. Qualified individuals with disabilities will be favored. The TU Berlin values the diversity of its members and is committed to the goals of equal opportunities.

Please send copies only. Original documents will not be returned.

PhD degree or equivalent, in a quantitative field (computer science, mathematics, natural language processing, artificial intelligence, or similar)At least one publication, as first author, in a leading journal or conference related to computer science, natural language processing or applied mathematics5+ years experience using machine learning or other NLP techniques2+ years experience implementing machine learning related techniques using Python or Scala in a distributed system, suitable for large scale2+ years experience working in a Linux environmentFluency in written and spoken English (German is not required)

As a Senior Applied Scientist on this growing team, you will take on a key role in the Natural Language Processing (NLP) teams for Amazon Search. We are developing NLP components that cover a wide range of languages, from English and other Indo-European languages to Turkish, Arabic, Japanese and many more, and play a central role in search query processing, product description indexing, string normalization and vector embeddings for queries and products.

You will use machine learning, tuned on terabytes of product and traffic data, to build or improve NLP technology that you will integrate with and evaluate, using techniques like A/B tests, in production. The approaches you choose for model architecture and training methods will balance business-defined performance indicators with the needs of millisecond response times. You will propose and explore publication-worthy innovation.

You will build relationships with stakeholders and partner teams across multiple countries, analyze data for trends, track down the source and meaning of anomalies, select suitable rule-based or machine-learning based techniques and increment over improvements, closing the loop through data, model, application and customer feedback.

Responsibilities
Analyze customer-focused problems in an industrial setting and provide accurate, efficient and innovative NLP/ML solutionsBuild NLP models that can be applied to multiple languagesEvaluate the proposed solutions via offline benchmark tests, online A/B tests in productionPublish the developed innovative solutions in leading academic scientific venues in NLP/ML

Experience working in data or applied science in a consumer product companyExperience in a leading role, deciding approaches, setting direction and/or mentoring others on the teamExperience using Deep Learning to solve NLP tasksExperience using Java or C++ writing production-ready codeFamiliarity with deep learning and machine learning frameworks such as SageMaker, PyTorch or TensorFlowExperience in low-level optimization of large-scale neural networksFluency in one or more languages other than English

Grover is the new alternative to buying or financing tech products

Grover offers a simple, monthly subscription model for the tech you love. We are the first financing company for the Circular Economy, breaking the link between ownership and usage. For a low monthly fee, private customers, as well as businesses, get access to a wide assortment of tech products at a fraction of the purchase price. We're on a mission to re-invent consumption and to make innovative technology accessible to everyone. As a member of the CE100 group of leading companies in the Circular Economy worldwide, we are at the forefront of reducing waste and establishing a more sustainable way of using products for both consumers and the environment.

To date, we have raised more than €100 million in equity and debt from investors including Samsung, Commerzbank, and Global Founders Capital. LinkedIn ranks Grover as one of the Top 10 hottest startups to work for in Germany in 2019.

About the Role:
Together with Data Scientist, Data engineers are the central node to the Data Strategy of Grover. As a Data Engineer, you will be interfacing with front-end and back-end engineers to collect insights about our customers. Every decision at Grover is data driven, you will be working on the systems and tools that define our analytical power.

Your Role:
Produce machine learning algorithms, help data scientists improve Grover platform
Build robust distributed systems to process large scale data streams into useful applications
Integrate and maintain new data management technologies and software into the existing system, building data collection pipelines.
Engineer fast, real-time data pipelines to process data from multiple sources to make fast and accurate decisions
Ability to design and build distributed data warehouses
Implement risk monitoring systems to improve tracking and mitigation of several risks including fraud
Work closely with data scientists and collaborate with back-end, front-end engineers to build products for gathering insights about customer behaviour
Create monitoring systems to track of the quality of data and the health of our systems

Your Profile:

Motivated and fast learner
Proficient in Python
Knowledge of SQL
Experience working with stream processing (Kafka, Faust, Spark, Hadoop)
Understanding of Distributed systems
Familiarity with Jenkins and Jira
Experience with Async programming (asyncio, tornado, twisted, Trio) is a plus
Experience working with REST APIs and/or SOAP is a plus

Technologies we use:

Python 3.6+ (Faust, sklearn, pandas, …)
PostgreSQL
AWS Suite (Lambda, Redshift, ...)
Elasticsearch, Logstash, Kibana (ELK)
Kafka
Redis
Zookeeper

What we offer you

Fun tech projects and ownership
A laptop of your choice (Windows or Mac)
Entrepreneurial responsibility and flat-hierarchies
Ownership of your work
Modern, spacious office located in central Berlin
Open-minded variety of nationalities
German Classes in the office
A fun workplace
Smunch
Fresh Fruit & Drinks
Team Events


About us

Grover is the European market leader in technology rentals, bringing the access economy to the consumer electronics market. If you want to work with a dedicated team at a purpose-driven, fast-growing company, increasing consumer welfare around the world, join us now. At Grover, we value entrepreneurship, intelligence, and speed in everything we do. We're a team of over 90 creative and motivated minds, from more than 31 countries – which means our aims, beliefs, and ways of working are influenced by many different perspectives. We care for individuality and for team spirit, act courageously and communicate openly. In our HQ, in Berlin Mitte, there is plenty of space for fun, collaboration, and rethinking the way the world does, uses and values things.

Mehr als 10.800 Filialen und 150 Logistikzentren in 30 Ländern – das ist Lidl. Um unsere anspruchsvollen Ziele weiterhin effizient erreichen zu können, suchen wir Dich als Verstärkung für unseren Analytics-Bereich. Hier begleiten wir Lidl auf dem Weg zu einem datengetriebenen Unternehmen und pilotieren im „Fail-Fast Ansatz“ innovative Business-Anwendungen im Schulterschluss mit den Fachabteilungen (Vertrieb, Einkauf etc.). Dazu beraten wir diese bei Fragestellungen und gestalten weltweite Geschäftsprozesse mit. Zusätzlich unterstützen wir die Länder, dezentral Analytics-Kompetenzen aufzubauen und durch eine enge Zusammenarbeit die internationalen Synergien zu schöpfen. Bewirke Großes und erlebe, dass sich Dein Einstieg lohnt – am internationalen Hauptsitz von Lidl in Neckarsulm.

Deine Aufgaben

Du identifizierst gemeinsam mit Fachexperten Fragestellungen, bei denen Advanced Analytics einen echten finanziellen Mehrwert für Lidl liefern
Du bereinigst und verknüpfst relevante Datenquellen als Grundlage für weitere Analysen
Du nutzt modernste Algorithmen, um unterschiedliche Geschäftsprozesse zu optimieren und führst den Proof-of-Concept herbei
Du führst gemeinsam mit Fachbereichen Piloten durch, um die Funktionsfähigkeit und den Mehrwert Deiner Modelle in der Praxis unter Beweis zu stellen
Du bereitest gemeinsam mit Kollegen aus der IT den Übergang zur Industrialisierung vor
Du bearbeitest Projekte in interdisziplinären, agilen Teams und präsentierst in regelmäßigen Abständen neue Ergebnisse vor Stakeholdern und dem Management

Dein Profil

Abgeschlossenes Hochschulstudium im Bereich Mathematik/Statistik, Informatik, Physik, VWL, BWL oder einer themenverwandten Fachrichtung
Idealerweise mehrjährige Berufserfahrung in den entsprechenden Themenbereichen
Sehr gute Kenntnisse in der Anwendung von Machine-Learning-, Optimierungs- und Data Mining-Methoden (z.B. mit Python oder R)
Kenntnisse im Umgang mit Datenbanken (SQL, Hadoop, Hive)
Erfahrung mit Methoden der agilen Produktentwicklung
Fähigkeit, komplexe Fragestellungen und Szenarien zu verstehen, detailliert zu analysieren und die gewonnenen Erkenntnisse einem nicht technischen Publikum verständlich zu präsentieren
Englischkenntnisse
Deutschkenntnisse erforderlich

Wir bieten

Wir legen Wert darauf, dass sich dein Einstieg bei uns lohnt! Daher profitierst du bei uns nicht nur von einer überdurchschnittlichen Vergütung und allen Sozialleistungen eines Großunternehmens. Wir erkennen die vielfältigen Bedürfnisse unserer Kolleginnen und Kollegen an und entwickeln Lösungen zur Vereinbarkeit von Berufs- und Privatleben. Ein persönlicher Pate macht dich vom ersten Tag an mit deinem Job vertraut und ist dein Ansprechpartner für alle Fragen, rund um das Unternehmen. So findest du dich bei uns schnell zurecht – und so kannst du von Beginn an das kollegiale Miteinander und die individuellen Weiterbildungsmöglichkeiten für dich entdecken.

Aus Gründen der leichteren Lesbarkeit verwenden wir im Textverlauf die männliche Form der Anrede. Selbstverständlich sind bei Lidl Menschen jeder Geschlechtsidentität willkommen.

Job_title: ML Engineer, Global Data & Insights - Assisted Relocation to Copenhagen, DK
Job_description:
Do you want to be a part of a fast-moving, dynamic, and international team? And are you passionate about delivering great, data-driven experiences in all touchpoints of the consumer journey? If so, we might have an exciting opportunity for you!
Job description and areas of responsibility:
As ML Engineer, you will deploy and continouosly integrate models to provide insights and ensure end-user have a great experience on our website. You will ensure that models are up to date and correctly implemented in the pipeline. Further to that, you will model data and build tools to be used by data scientist creating ML models for various applications within the organisation – driving development and innovation in the area of AI systems.

As ML Engineer, your key accountabilities will be to:

Model pipelines
Build Python packages or helper other modules, that will be used by data scientist
Deploy ML models (or its output) by developing integrations to other systems or deploy endpoints
Apply data modelling and normalisation techniques on inbound data that is going to be used in the development of ML models
Manage data pipelining surrounding the development of ML models
Your new team:
Say hello to the Global Data & Insights team at Pandora. We are a group of 8 data-driven professionals who support the global marketing teams at Pandora with actionable insights. We have a data lake, a unified analytics platform and solid communication skills that help us translate data into business value. Your new team consists of data scientists, data engineers and an audience manager. Our mission is clear: We are here to deliver data-driven experiences in all consumer journey touchpoints, develop actionable insights to inform business decisions and have fun while doing it.


What is needed to succeed:
We imagine that you have minimum 1 year of professional experience from working with Software Engineering/developing, Computer Science or ML Engineering.

Furthermore, we envision that you have demonstrable experience with:

Git, Python, Spark, PySpark, SQL or similar
Feature engineering
Data modelling and normalization
ML model lifecycle
SDLC methodology
Something about you:
How would you rate yourself on the 4 C’s? We believe that communication, collaboration, critical thinking and creativity are key competences that will help anyone regardless of job function, title or skillset, in becoming a success. If you can see yourself working in a fast-paced entrepreneurial environment with many stakeholders, where your communication and interpersonal skills are needed and your ability to collaborate and innovate as a team is essential, we would love to hear from you.


Additional information:
Application deadline: April 14, 2020

Expected start date: As soon as possible

This role is based in the Pandora Global Office in Copenhagen, Denmark.
Did we get your attention?
We hope you got all your questions answered and feel confident applying for this position, however if you have more questions regarding the position, please contact:

Neil Andrews
Recruiter, Global Office HR
+44 797 378 7498
extneand@pandora.net

If you see yourself in the position and would like to become a part of Pandora’s future PLEASE CLICK HERE TO APPLY. We look forward to hearing from you!

We process applications on a continuous basis, which is why we encourage you to send your application as soon as possible. You can also read more about Pandora on our corporate site www.pandoragroup.com.
Icing on the cake
You will be working out of our beautiful Head Office in Copenhagen V, established in 2016 and designed to unite and inspire our teams. Besides our beautiful interior design we are also proud of our LEED Gold Certification for Energy and Environmental Design. This means that we use as few natural resources as possible and that we use them with respect. The result is a professional and dynamic space that is unique, comfortable and inspirational – and delivers a true Pandora experience to anyone who works here or comes to visit.

So findest du dich bei uns schnell zurecht – und so kannst du von Beginn an das kollegiale Miteinander und die individuellen Weiterbildungsmöglichkeiten für dich entdecken.

Aus Gründen der leichteren Lesbarkeit verwenden wir im Textverlauf die männliche Form der Anrede. Selbstverständlich sind bei Lidl Menschen jeder Geschlechtsidentität willkommen.

Job_title: Technische Referentinnen und Referenten (m/w/d) in der Analyseunterstützung und Datengewinnung
Job_description:
Wir suchen zur Verstärkung unserer Teams an den Dienstorten Berlin und Köln mehrere
Technische Referentinnen und Referenten (m/w/d) in der Analyseunterstützung und Datengewinnung
Ihre Aufgaben
Das Bundesamt für Verfassungsschutz (BfV) leistet als Inlandsnachrichtendienst der Bundesrepublik Deutschland einen wesentlichen Beitrag für die Sicherheit der Bürgerinnen und Bürger.
Im Bereich der technischen Analyseunterstützung und Datengewinnung des BfV setzen Sie Ihre IT-Fachkenntnisse unter Anwendung eines modernen Tech-Stack zur technischen Erhebung, Aufbereitung oder Verknüpfung von nachrichtendienstlich relevanten Daten ein.
Sie arbeiten in komplexen, spezialisierten IT-Systemen, i.d.R. auf Linux- und Open-Source-Basis, als Software- bzw. Systementwickler/in, Techn. IT-Sicherheits- / Schwachstellenanalyst/in, Systemingenieur/in, Systemadministrator/in, Projektmanager/in oder Data Scientist.
Mögliche Einsatzbereiche sind der Cloud- / Plattformbetrieb und deren Weiterentwicklung, KI / Machine Learning / Big Data, Netzwerkforensik / Datenstromanalyse, IT- / Datenträgerforensik, Computer Network Exploitation und die Technische Datengewinnung / -erfassung.
Wir bieten
Sinnhaftigkeit
spannende Tätigkeit mit gesellschaftlichem Mehrwert und aktuellem politischen Bezug
Weiterentwicklung
durch Fortbildungen, gute berufliche Entwicklungsmöglichkeiten, vielfältige Einsatzbereiche
Fairness
flexible Arbeitszeiten, Überstundenausgleich durch Freizeit, familienfreundliches Arbeitsumfeld, auch durch individuelle Teilzeitmodelle
Teamzugehörigkeit
gute Arbeitsatmosphäre, Mentoring, Onboarding, Teil der Sicherheitscommunity
Gehalt und Perspektive
unbefristete Einstellung in die EG 13 TVöD Bund sowie Möglichkeit der späteren Verbeamtung
Übernahme von Beamtinnen und Beamten bis A 14 BBesG bei Vorliegen der laufbahnrechtlichen Voraussetzungen
Zahlung einer Nachrichtendienstzulage
Zahlung einer IT-Fachkräftezulage sowie weitere Gehaltsanhebungen nach Einzelfallprüfung möglich
Ihr Profil
Sie besitzen die deutsche Staatsangehörigkeit und verfügen über
ein abgeschlossenes wissenschaftliches Hochschulstudium (Master / Univ.-Diplom) der Fachrichtung Informatik, Mathematik, Physik oder
ein sonstiges wissenschaftliches Hochschulstudium mit IT-bezogener Ausrichtung.
Ebenfalls können sich Studierende bewerben, die den Abschluss eines solchen Studiums in Kürze anstreben.
Darüber hinaus erwarten wir
ein gutes schriftliches und mündliches Ausdrucksvermögen
die Fähigkeit zu konzeptionellem, analytischem und teamorientiertem Arbeiten
gute Kenntnisse in mindestens einem dieser Bereiche
Projektmanagement, idealerweise in Scrum oder PRINCE2®
Programmiersprachen: C / C++, Assembler (x86 / ARM), Go, Java, R oder Scala
Skriptsprachen: Python, Perl, Shell-Scripting
Erfahrung in Big-Data-Entwicklungsprojekten, Data Mining oder Business Intelligence
Software Reverse Engineering / Schwachstellenanalyse Windows, Linux, Android, macOS / iOS
Wir haben uns die berufliche Förderung von Frauen nach Maßgabe des BGleiG zum Ziel gesetzt und sind deshalb besonders an Bewerbungen von Frauen interessiert. Schwerbehinderte Menschen werden bei gleicher Eignung nach Maßgabe des SGB IX bevorzugt berücksichtigt.
Bitte bewerben Sie sich bis zum 17.04.2020 über das Online-Bewerbungssystem unter der Verfahrensnummer BfV-2019-105 auf https://bewerbung.dienstleistungszentrum.de/BfV-2019-105/index.html.
Das Bestehen von schriftlichen und mündlichen Eignungstests ist Voraussetzung für die weitere Bearbeitung Ihrer Bewerbung. Nähere Informationen rund um das Bewerbungsverfahren und die erforderliche Sicherheitsüberprüfung für eine Tätigkeit im Inlandsnachrichtendienst des Bundes finden Sie unter www.verfassungsschutz.de/karriere.
Für Fragen im Zusammenhang mit Ihrer Bewerbung stehen Ihnen die Mitarbeiter/innen vom Bundesverwaltungsamt – Servicezentrum Personalgewinnung – unter der Rufnummer 0228 99358-8690 gerne zur Verfügung.

Job_title: Data Engineer, Advanced Analytics - Assisted Relocation to Copenhagen, DK
Job_description:
Do you want to be a part of ensuring data driven growth at the world’s largest jewellery brand? Are you passionate about creating solution designs and working on critical projects? If yes, then we have an exciting opportunity for you!
Job description and areas of responsibility:
For our growing Data Platform team within Consumer Technology, we are looking for a new Data Engineer of Advanced Analytics. You will be responsible for expanding and optimising our data and data pipeline architecture, as well as optimising data flow and collection for cross-functional teams. This will include assembling large, complex data sets that meet functional/non-functional business requirements.

As our Data Engineer, you will identify, design and implement internal process improvements, automating manual processes, optimizing data delivery, re-designing infrastructure for greater scalability, amongst other tasks. You will also build the infrastructure required for optimal extraction, transformation, and loading of data from a wide variety of data sources using a wide array of available technologies. In addition, you will create data tools for analytics and data scientist team members that assist them in building and optimising our data products.

Further to the above, you will:

Build analytical tools that utilise the data pipeline to provide actionable insights into customer acquisition, operational efficiency and other key business performance metrics
Support our Data Architects, fellow Data Engineers and Data Scientists on new project initiatives and will ensure optimal data delivery architecture is consistent throughout ongoing projects
Work with stakeholders and teams to assist with data-related technical issues and support their data infrastructure needs
Work with data and analytics experts to strive for greater functionality in our data systems


Your new team:
Pandora is a company with a big heart that takes great pride in treating our people well. You will be part of an exciting business area and work in an international hub of can-do spirited, passionate and performance-driven people. Consumer Technology has just started a transformation where we over the next 12-24 months will implement new ways of working to support the execution of Business Strategy, enable operational excellence and build a data-driven organisation.

Our Data Platform team is the epicentre of Pandora’s ambitious plans to become a world leading retailer in Advanced Analytics. We are investing significantly into these ambitions and we leverage a strong position as a fully vertically integrated producer and reseller with internal data sets spanning from Supply to Demand. You will report to the Manager of Engineering & QA.

What is needed to succeed:
We imagine that you have a university degree within Computer Science, Information Technology or Engineering. You understand data tools and management, data integration and database development techniques, and have previous experience with relating architectural decision and recommendations to business needs.

Further to this, you have:
Minimum 3-5 years of experience from working with Entity Relationship modelling, metadata systems, data quality tools and techniques
Worked with BI and reporting
Worked with UML (use case and class models)
Strong experience with database technologies (e.g. SQL, NoSQL, Oracle, Hadoop, Teradata)
Experience developing reference architecture, principles and standards
Something about you:
You might be the person we are looking for if you are a data genius, whether managing, integrating or organising it. You are very structured and easily learn new technology. Furthermore, you are analytical and thrive with finding solutions to technical problems. Aside from being a technical genius, you are confident in communicating with all levels of an organisation and enjoy working with diverse project teams.


Additional information:
Application deadline: March 31, 2020
Expected start date: As soon as possible
This role is based in the Pandora Global Office in Copenhagen, Denmark. Candidates should be willing to travel approximately 20 days a year.


Did we get your attention?
We hope you got all your questions answered and feel confident applying for this position, however if you have more questions regarding the position, please contact:
Christian Sylvester
Recruiter, Global Office HR
+45 27 50 90 78
If you see yourself in the position and would like to become a part of Pandora’s future PLEASE CLICK HERE TO APPLY. We look forward to hearing from you!

We process applications on a continuous basis, which is why we encourage you to send your application as soon as possible. You can also read more about Pandora on our corporate site www.pandoragroup.com.


Icing on the cake
You will be working out of our beautiful Head Office in Copenhagen V, established in 2016 and designed to unite and inspire our teams. Besides our beautiful interior design we are also proud of our LEED Gold Certification for Energy and Environmental Design. This means that we use as few natural resources as possible and that we use them with respect. The result is a professional and dynamic space that is unique, comfortable and inspirational – and delivers a true Pandora experience to anyone who works here or comes to visit.

Mehr als 10.800 Filialen und 150 Logistikzentren in 30 Ländern – das ist Lidl. Um unsere anspruchsvollen Ziele weiterhin effizient erreichen zu können, suchen wir Dich als Verstärkung für unseren Analytics-Bereich. Hier begleiten wir Lidl auf dem Weg zu einem datengetriebenen Unternehmen und pilotieren im „Fail-Fast Ansatz“ innovative Business-Anwendungen im Schulterschluss mit den Fachabteilungen (Vertrieb, Einkauf etc.). Dazu beraten wir diese bei Fragestellungen und gestalten weltweite Geschäftsprozesse mit. Zusätzlich unterstützen wir die Länder, dezentral Analytics-Kompetenzen aufzubauen und durch eine enge Zusammenarbeit die internationalen Synergien zu schöpfen. Bewirke Großes und erlebe, dass sich Dein Einstieg lohnt – am internationalen Hauptsitz von Lidl in Neckarsulm.

Deine Aufgaben

Du identifizierst gemeinsam mit Fachexperten Fragestellungen, bei denen Advanced Analytics einen echten finanziellen Mehrwert für Lidl liefern
Du bereinigst und verknüpfst relevante Datenquellen als Grundlage für weitere Analysen
Du nutzt modernste Algorithmen, um unterschiedliche Geschäftsprozesse zu optimieren und führst den Proof-of-Concept herbei
Du führst gemeinsam mit Fachbereichen Piloten durch, um die Funktionsfähigkeit und den Mehrwert Deiner Modelle in der Praxis unter Beweis zu stellen
Du bereitest gemeinsam mit Kollegen aus der IT den Übergang zur Industrialisierung vor
Du bearbeitest Projekte in interdisziplinären, agilen Teams und präsentierst in regelmäßigen Abständen neue Ergebnisse vor Stakeholdern und dem Management

Dein Profil

Abgeschlossenes Hochschulstudium im Bereich Mathematik/Statistik, Informatik, Physik, VWL, BWL oder einer themenverwandten Fachrichtung
Idealerweise mehrjährige Berufserfahrung in den entsprechenden Themenbereichen
Sehr gute Kenntnisse in der Anwendung von Machine-Learning-, Optimierungs- und Data Mining-Methoden (z.B. mit Python oder R)
Kenntnisse im Umgang mit Datenbanken (SQL, Hadoop, Hive)
Erfahrung mit Methoden der agilen Produktentwicklung
Fähigkeit, komplexe Fragestellungen und Szenarien zu verstehen, detailliert zu analysieren und die gewonnenen Erkenntnisse einem nicht technischen Publikum verständlich zu präsentieren
Englischkenntnisse
Deutschkenntnisse erforderlich

Wir bieten

Wir legen Wert darauf, dass sich dein Einstieg bei uns lohnt! Daher profitierst du bei uns nicht nur von einer überdurchschnittlichen Vergütung und allen Sozialleistungen eines Großunternehmens. Wir erkennen die vielfältigen Bedürfnisse unserer Kolleginnen und Kollegen an und entwickeln Lösungen zur Vereinbarkeit von Berufs- und Privatleben. Ein persönlicher Pate macht dich vom ersten Tag an mit deinem Job vertraut und ist dein Ansprechpartner für alle Fragen, rund um das Unternehmen. So findest du dich bei uns schnell zurecht – und so kannst du von Beginn an das kollegiale Miteinander und die individuellen Weiterbildungsmöglichkeiten für dich entdecken.

Aus Gründen der leichteren Lesbarkeit verwenden wir im Textverlauf die männliche Form der Anrede. Selbstverständlich sind bei Lidl Menschen jeder Geschlechtsidentität willkommen.

Aus Gründen der leichteren Lesbarkeit verwenden wir im Textverlauf die männliche Form der Anrede. Selbstverständlich sind bei Lidl Menschen jeder Geschlechtsidentität willkommen.

Deine Aufgaben
Analysiere riesige Datenmengen innerhalb eines datengesteuerten Unternehmens, um wichtige Geschäftsentscheidungen zu unterstützen
Über 2.0 Milliarden Kunden auf der ganzen Welt nutzen unser Produkt. Leite aus den Ereignisströmen Nutzungsmuster ab und schlage mögliche Produktinnovationen vor
Nutze moderne Techniken des Data Mining und des Machine Learning, um das Kundenverhalten zu verstehen. Definition von Kundenclustern und Profilsegmenten aus internen und externen Daten
Analysiere das Netzwerk gegenseitiger Interaktionen und sozialer Beziehungen zwischen den Kunden über Diagrammdatenbanken
Kooperiere mit anderen Abteilungen im Team, um Lösungen für wichtige Geschäftsprobleme zu entwickeln, unter Verwendung gemeinsamer Tools und firmeneigener Algorithmen für den Aufbau von Anwendungen
Zusammenarbeit mit anderen Datenwissenschaftlern im Unternehmen, lerne fortschrittliche Methoden aus erster Hand
Was wir Dir bieten
Es dreht sich alles um das Team: werde Teil einer Gemeinschaft, in der gegenseitige Unterstützung über Abteilungen hinweg und offenes Feedback großgeschrieben werden
Unsere Grundgehälter spiegeln den Marktstandard wider und werden aufgrund Deiner Fähigkeiten und Erfahrungen erhöht. Zusätzliche Boni werden für gute Arbeit und den Erfolg des Unternehmens angeboten
Selbstverständlich bieten wir Dir kostenloses Obst, alkoholfreie Getränke und ein abwechslungsreiches Sportprogramm
Eine gute Work-Life-Balance mit wöchentlichem Home-Office, flexiblen Arbeitszeiten und keiner Zeiterfassung
Gelebte Diversität: Deine zukünftigen KollegInnen kommen aus über 60 Ländern und sprechen mehr als 40 Sprachen
Was Du mitbringst
Ein erfolgreich abgeschlossenes Studium im Bereich Mathematik/Statistik, Informatik oder gleichwertig
Mehr als 2 Jahre Berufserfahrung in der Datenanalyse, Erfahrung mit Big Data ist ein Pluspunkt
Vertraut mit Verfahren wie: Logistische Regression, Entscheidungsbäume, k-Mittel, Neuronale Netze, Textmining. Erfahrung mit Diagrammdatenbanken ist von Vorteil
Realisierte Projekte in Data Handling & Analysis Projekten, praktische Erfahrungen im Python Data Mining sowie traditionelle SQL Use Cases. Map-Reduce, Spark, Hive oder Kafka sind sehr gerne gesehen
Nachweislich Programmierkenntnisse in Python (wird im Interviewprozess getestet), Java, Spark oder Scala sind von großem Vorteil
Hoch motiviert, komplexe Probleme in enger Zusammenarbeit mit anderen zu lösen
Zielorientiert und bestrebt, echte Geschäftseffekte zu erzielen
Unterstützung des Teams und keine Scheu freiwillig einzuspringen, wenn Not am Mann ist
Teile aktiv Deine eigene Meinung und nimm Feedback von anderen entgegen
Sehr gute Englischkenntnisse

Senior Data Scientist – Growth, Autos Marketplace (f/m/d)

OUR COMPANY
The eBay Classifieds Group (eCG) is an innovative global leader in online classifieds. Our sites help people find whatever they are looking for in their local communities. Every connection made or item found makes a difference by creating a world where people share more and waste less. We have eleven brands that span the globe offering online classifieds in more than 1,000 cities around the world.
eBay Classified Group is always looking for high-energy, self-motivated, committed individuals who are passionate about their work. Our team members enjoy a challenging environment that places the highest value on innovation, accountability and playing to win. Our culture is based on open and honest communication, respect for other points of view and a spirit of fun. We look forward to hearing from you.
OUR TEAM
We believe that data is the voice of the customer. Through customer research and continuous experimentation, we make sure the customer is involved in building the best classifieds experience in the world. We’ve organized around the key stages of the customer, where every journey team is a matrix team consisting of product managers, business owners, UX designers, developers and marketers.
You will be part of a new Growth Team for our Global Autos Marketplace. This is a fast-paced team that will be responsible for optimizing the customer funnel – acquisition, activation, and retention growth rates. The individuals on this team are highly motivated to create new channels and optimize features that drive user activation and engagement with our Autos marketplace. This team’s core capability will be data-driven rapid experimentation to identify winners that ultimately increase our drive Auto buyers to connect with Sellers.
YOUR JOB
We are looking for someone who has helped grow world-class products that people love. As a senior data scientist, you’ll work closely with product, engineering, design, marketing, and other data teams. You’ll dig in to deeply understand to derive customer insights, define and analyze growth experiments, and guide/help the team to build their data analysis and experimentation acumen. Key responsibilities include:
Identify opportunities and validate factors that drive the acquisition & activation of users.
Design experiments and interpret results to bring quick and actionable insights to the table.
Lead, manage, and maintain best practices for rapid experimentation.
Uncover users’ needs using exploratory analysis, predictive modelling, and statistics.
Actively participate in hypothesis generation and driving product decisions.
Communicate findings with stakeholders, including senior management.
Collaborate with data scientists, analysts, UX designers, and product managers from local and global teams.
Be a contributing member of a global data community. Coach and mentor more junior colleagues.
YOUR SKILLS
3-5 years of experience in an Analytical function applying insights/models and working with product/marketing teams.
An M.Sc. or Ph.D. degree (e.g. Economics, Physics, Computer Science, Statistics, or similar).
Background and/or experience in Marketing sciences is a plus.
Advanced knowledge in A/B testing and related statistical methods.
Experience using statistical models and ML for data exploration, predictive analysis, and causal inference.
Proficient at working with large data. Good knowledge of SQL. Familiarity with Hadoop, Presto and/or Spark is a plus. Experienced in R and/or Python.
Coaching or teaching experience is a plus.
Strong communicator and fluent in English.
Driven and demonstrating creativity and initiative.
